text:
Upgraded from 7.0.27 to 7.0.32 using yum update. After the update, the service status check returns blank.

Command executed:

    [root@linux]# service tomcat7 status

Expected output:

     tomcat7 (pid ####) is running...                           [  OK  ]

Command Output:

    [root@linux]# service tomcat7 status
    [root@linux]#                            [  OK  ]
    [root@linux]#


-Noman A.
creator: n.amir.jamil@gmail.com

text: The Tomcat project does not provide that feature. You need to talk to whoever provided the package you installed.
creator: markt@apache.org

text:
I am sorry, but I don't follow you. Are you saying Tomcat service status check does not come under Tomcat project?

This is a normal linux installation using yum. Previous version worked without any issues.

Can you please point me to the right direction here, really appreciate your help.

-NomanA.
creator: n.amir.jamil@gmail.com

text:
1. Official Apache Tomcat releases are not distributed through yum, but are downloadable from  http://tomcat.apache.org/

2. There are many ways to install Tomcat in an operating system.

Different flavors of Linux manage system services differently, and layout of Tomcat files differs between OS vendors, based on their preferences.

The OS-specific service startup scripts are not provided by Apache Tomcat project, but by your (unnamed) OS vendor.


If you have further questions on using Tomcat, you may ask on the users@ mailing list. Do not forget to provide as much details as possible on your software versions, configuration, etc. See http://tomcat.apache.org/
creator: knst.kolinko@gmail.com
